Datatable.LocalizationPair: Determines whether the ESG Food rework will be enabled. If partially enabled, there will be new empire improvements to convert excess food into other resources. If fully enabled, then population growth will be uncapped by a constructible element
You will use ESG food. There will be options to convert excess food into other resources and additional population.
You will partially use ESG food. There will be options to convert excess food into other resources, but not into additional population.
You will use Vanilla food. Excess food will be wasted, and only 1 population can grow per turn.
Using innovative technologies alongside food surplus it is possible to create population, albeit at an extra cost.
Using innovative technologies alongside food surplus it is possible to create population, albeit at an extra cost.

The Garrison represents the ability of the system to repel ground invasions. The [systemDefenseColored] Garrison Manpower and [foodColored] Food Conversion gradually restore this value, while enemy sieges and ground battle losses reduce it. Excess [systemDefenseColored] Manpower is sent to the [manpowerColored] Empire Manpower stock.
Resource Generation on Strategic Resource Deposit

+1 Resource Generation on T1 Strategic Deposits on System Level 2 +1 Resource Generation on T2 Strategic Deposits on System Level 3 +1 Resource Generation on T3 Strategic Deposits on System Level 4 (Scales with Game Speed)
[blue-gray](Can only be built on a System of Level 4)#REVERT#
Resource Generation on Strategic Resource Deposit
Through careful analysis of waste and the appropriate reclamation and filtration techniques, the hero is able to salvage meaningful quantities of resources seemingly out of thin air.
+2 of each Luxury used in System Development upgrades (No additional bonus for duplicate Luxuries)
+50% effect from [fidsi] and [happinessColored] Population Effect bonuses
effect from [fidsi] and [happinessColored] Population Effect bonuses
+33% effect from [fidsi] and [happinessColored] Population Effect bonuses
+50% effect from [fidsi] and [happinessColored] Population Effect bonuses

Due to the similarities between many extractive ventures, a bit of Dust and some study in one field has quickly extended to many others, allowing the Hero to maximize production of both the finest luxuries and the most volatile strategic resources.
+25 Defensive Bombardment Damage on Population per Minor Faction Assimilated
+25 Defensive Bombardment Damage during ground battle on Population per Backdoor
+15 Defensive Bombardment Damage on Population per System Level
This is an agreement to share faction advantages with the Sophon. Your faction will gain +0.83% [scienceColored] on Systems per Turn [turn] (Max: 25%), increase scales with game speed.

A science bonus is given for discovering technologies based on how many players have already researched it: the fewer know it, the higher the reduction on the next research.
Starting Ships: 1x [colonizer], 1x [explorer] Faction Pact: +0.83% [scienceColored] per [turn] (Max: 25%)
This is an agreement to share faction advantages with the Riftborn. Your faction will gain +0.67% [industryColored] on Systems per Turn [turn] (Max: 20%), increase scales with game speed.

Can build Singularities, and affect time by placing them on a system. Singularities have a fixed duration and can only be placed on a system within the empire's vision
Starting Ships: 1x [colonizer], 1x [explorer] Faction Pact: +0.67% [industryColored] per [turn] (Max: 20%)
Scrupulous Scientific Examination of Cultural Artifacts

The relics of the past are a thing to be studied using the scientific method! By providing research institutions the ability to get their hands on our relics, we will be ushering in an age known only to our ancestors! Our believers may protest the sacrilege of converting their places of worships into a science fair, but one must make way for progress.

The relics of our past have been through a millenia of history using newfound methods of Dust-9 dating. By performing careful scans, we can get a clearer understanding of what the microscopic traces of dust on each relic have been through, and of course of our unrecorded history.
Allows the Argosy to consume all Movement Points to act as a Mobile Portal Argosy can Cloak Fleets at Level 1 without Modules
Portal use costs only 1 Movement Point (Bonus also applies to allies with the Metafolding Affinity)

Divided between cold and disinterested masters and their slaves, Craver society can offer few incentives to its denizens. However, by exploiting luxuries as a reward for collaborators and additives for the main Craver population, a profitable system of incentives can still be achieved.

Both Cravers and their victims long ago realized that eating the labor force was not a good long term plan, and so food growing programs were created to take advantage of a planets natural biosphere for more efficient and sustainable fueling of the war machine.

Dust-empowered individuals are few and far between, but not too difficult to find during the food conversion process. By removing both Craver and conquered from the population when these talents show themselves, we can maintain an elite Dust labor force who shall live short, but significantly more pleasant lives until the construction efforts burn them out.

Cravers and their slaves derive little joy from the empires progress, but by hooking the former into a mental network and giving the latter constant updates from screens and speakers, every achievement can heighten the excitement of the Cravers and beat down the hope of their victims in real-time.

By obtaining other factions guides to diplomacy and facial recognition databases, we can create Craver specialists programmed to identify and exploit not only the emotional responses of other factions, but also of conquered populations who might be more amenable to the carrot or the stick at any moment.

One of the limits of natural evolution is that it cannot handle large changes well, as species are wiped out by disasters or predators which are too great a difference for them - Predators like the Cravers. By setting aside entire continents to only ever be attacked by Craver scouts and raiding parties that they can just about handle, we can observe our own weaknesses in an arena where our economy of scale will not obscure the results.

By establishing "foreign exchange" arrangements with allies and offering hits of Dust-9 to famous figures in other empires, the Cravers can offer significant incentives to foreign politicians as an incentive to collaborate, and the threat of punishing famous prisoners and entire populations of their distant relatives as a convenient threat to prevent war without ruining the reputation of said politicians at home.

Through intense experimentation, we have created an offshoot of the Craver species whose birth is caused by the chemical triggers of valuable strategic resources. Cheap, tough, and tireless, these worker drone hives are well suited to the most dangerous of environments.

While it is dangerous to allow educated members of the empire and its victims such unrestricted access to one another, giving scientists and their families exemption from hard labor in return for working with Craver scientists can prove a boon, especially when provided with expendable Craver assistants which will not complain about radiation or experimentation.

By putting a new variety of cheap, expendable Dust-consuming Cravers under the command of regular Cravers with a mastery of Dust, we can mine vast amounts of it at extremely low cost using these self-sustaining mini-hives of hungerless workers and clairvoyant overseers.

Cravers are a heavy species, not least due to being cyborgs, and that can make life on a gas giant more difficult. While they are no longer recognizable as Cravers and make the rest of their species uncomfortable, prefab hives of dormant aerial drones can be deployed to harvest and explore these worlds as though they were native to the environment.

While the Sophons are generally are interested in using the most cutting edge technology in the development of their labs with the expectation that advanced tools will beget more advanced tech, in the matter of laboratory radiation shielding they are traditionalists, constructing sprawling underground campuses modeled off of the steam cave communities of Hekim to accommodate entire towns of researchers and their families.

There's a time and place for everything, but the time and place for metallurgy is immediately and on the hottest planets we can find. By setting up industrial-scale forges on planets already hot enough to melt metal using only its hellish atmospheric forces, industrial manufacturing can run at breakneck speeds. While there are small inefficiencies with the materials the factories are made out of melting, the gains far outweight the costs.

While sanitization is always important when studying biology, advances in xenobiology have uncovered new ways of perfectly sterilizing equipment to reduce any chance of contamination. The downside? This only works on planets with temperatures far below most would consider habitable, but the research applications are too good to ignore.
+25 [dustColored] Bonus increases by 25 [dustcolored] / [turn] +5 [dustColored] / [turn] per Singularity ever built
+50% Health Regeneration Rate on Ships Orbiting or Garrisoned
Must be built on a System with a Luxury Deposit
Must be built on a System of Level 4
Must be built on a System with a Moon
Game Settings force Alliances to be permanent

Can accumulate Keii and use it to launch Keii actions to boost the military and production capacities of systems. Keii also determines empire and system Obedience, which replaces Approval. +40% [honorColored] Keii from Space Battles under the Keii zone of Behemoths.
Starting Ships: 2x [explorer] Faction Pact: +1% [systemDefenseColored] Garrison Manpower generation per [turn] (Max: 30%)

Cannot build Colonizers, but instead Vineships, which are used to extend your Vines to adjacent systems. Uncolonized systems in the vine network are colonized instantly. Planets in colonized systems require no industry to colonize. Can only engage in Diplomacy with Minor Factions in the Vine Network Vined systems are granted the following: • +10% [foodColored] • +10 [happinessColored] • -20% Siege Manpower Damage +1000 [systemDefenseColored] Garrison Capacity on Capital
Starting Ships: 1x [unfallen], 1x [explorer] Faction Pact: +1 [happinessColored] per [turn] (Max: 30%) +1% [honorColored] Gain per [turn] for Hissho (Max: 30%)
Determines how alliances will be treated.
Alliances will be unable to be formed.
Alliances will function normally, and no pre-decided teams will be enforced.

Two teams will automatically be created based off of the following rule: Team 1: Players 1, 3, 5, 7, 9, and 11 Team 2: Players 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12 [red]Forced Alliances cannot receive or lose members#REVERT#

Three teams will automatically be created based off of the following rule: Team 1: Players 1, 4, 7, and 10 Team 2: Players 2, 5, 8, and 11 Team 3: Players 3, 6, 9, and 12 [red]Forced Alliances cannot receive or lose members#REVERT#

Four teams will automatically be created based off of the following rule: Team 1: Players 1, 5, and 9 Team 2: Players 2, 6, and 10 Team 3: Players 3, 7, and 11 Team 4: Players 4, 8 and 12 [red]Forced Alliances cannot receive or lose members#REVERT#

Six teams will automatically be created based off of the following rule: Team 1: Players 1 and 7 Team 2: Players 2 and 8 Team 3: Players 3 and 9 Team 4: Players 4 and 10 Team 5: Players 5 and 11 Team 6: Players 6 and 12 [red]Forced Alliances cannot receive or lose members#REVERT#

The total Approval of your empire, calculated as an average of star system Approval ratings weighted by population. High and low approval values can influence the [scienceColored] and [dustColored] outputs of your star systems.
#4FC84F#Devoted#REVERT# - 85-100+ [happinessColored] (+30% [scienceColored] & [dustColored]) #B4C84F#Loyal#REVERT# - 70-85 [happinessColored] (+15% [scienceColored] & [dustColored]) #E1E1E1#Content#REVERT# - 30-70 [happinessColored] (No effects) #E1D768#Defiant#REVERT# - 15-30 [happinessColored] (-15% [scienceColored] & [dustColored]) #C84F4F#Traitorous#REVERT#: 0-15 [happinessColored] (-30% [scienceColored] & [dustColored])

The Approval level of people living in this star system. High and low approval values can influence the [foodColored] and [prestigeColored] outputs of the star system.
#4FC84F#Ecstatic#REVERT# - 85-100+ [happinessColored] (+30% [foodColored] & [prestigeColored]) #B4C84F#Happy#REVERT# - 70-85 [happinessColored] (+15% [foodColored] & [prestigeColored]) #E1E1E1#Content#REVERT# - 30-70 [happinessColored] (No effects) #E1D768#Unhappy#REVERT# - 15-30 [happinessColored] (-15% [foodColored] & [prestigeColored]) #C84F4F#Mutinous#REVERT#: 0-15 [happinessColored] (-30% [foodColored] & [prestigeColored])

The total Obedience of your empire, bound to your Keii. High and low Obedience values can influence the [scienceColored] and [dustColored] outputs of your Systems.
#4FC84F#Devoted#REVERT#: 85-100+ [obedienceColored] (+30% [scienceColored] & [dustColored]) #B4C84F#Loyal#REVERT#: 70-85 [obedienceColored] (+15% [scienceColored] & [dustColored]) #E1E1E1#Dutiful#REVERT#: 30-70 [obedienceColored] (No effects) #E1D768#Defiant#REVERT#: 15-30 [obedienceColored] (-15% [scienceColored] & [dustColored]) #C84F4F#Seditious#REVERT#: 0-15 [obedienceColored] (-30% [scienceColored] & [dustColored])

The Obedience level of people living in this star system. High and low approval values can influence the [foodColored] and [prestigeColored] outputs of the star system.
#4FC84F#Devoted#REVERT#: 85-100+ [obedienceColored] (+30% [foodColored] & [prestigeColored]) #B4C84F#Loyal#REVERT#: 70-85 [obedienceColored] (+15% [foodColored] & [prestigeColored]) #E1E1E1#Dutiful#REVERT#: 30-70 [obedienceColored] (No effects) #E1D768#Defiant#REVERT#: 15-30 [obedienceColored] (-15% [foodColored] & [prestigeColored]) #C84F4F#Seditious#REVERT#: 0-15 [obedienceColored] (-30% [foodColored] & [prestigeColored])

The political bodies of the faction are not designed to change quickly, or even at all, so their reforms are constantly at risk of returning to the traditional status quo without immense support.

"Micro" may be an exaggeration, but for how long range these teleporters are, they do transport very little - specifically, the new sailors and marines necessary to crew the empires most distant starships, sent on a one-way trip to distant stars where they may complain far, far away from the people who sent them.

Displays the chance that civilian Population will be killed using this Tactic. Negative numbers mean population are less likely to be killed, and positive numbers mean population are more likely to be killed.

Displays the chance that System Improvements will be destroyed using this Tactic. Negative numbers mean improvements are less likely to be destroyed, and positive numbers mean improvements are more likely to be destroyed.

The sun beats down, sweltering, and sweat prickles your brow. The noisy bloodlust of the crowd together with the dry dust churned up by the combatants, suffocates too. For a dizzying moment, you wonder what possessed you to accept the $MinorFactionName leader's invitation to their bloodsports arena, but then you remember: you court their civilization, and hope these are necessary steps towards the $MinorFactionName's assimilation into your empire. Far below, a fighter in golden scale neatly rolls to one side through the sand, and impales the last of the tri-headed mechanical snakes. The beast slumps to the ground, electricity crackling over its metallic form, and the crowd roars their approval. The leader leans close, its smell powerful and unpleasant. "That's my Finance Minister. He lives and breathes economics--but first and foremost, he's a warrior." The $MinorFactionName lowers its voice. "Show me your passion for violence, and you will have our loyalty,"
Demonstrating your civilization's militarism shouldn't be too difficult--you just hope you don't have to go to war to prove your colors.
Unlock additional star system improvements through research in the Military quadrant
The $MinorFactionName leader sends their congratulations upon learning of the swell towards militarism across your Empire. The $MinorFactionName are now happy to join your empire.

Displays the chance that civilian Population will be killed using this Tactic. Negative numbers mean population are less likely to be killed, and positive numbers mean population are more likely to be killed.

Displays the chance that System Improvements will be destroyed using this Tactic. Negative numbers mean improvements are less likely to be destroyed, and positive numbers mean improvements are more likely to be destroyed.
Troops will prioritize causing economic devastation to the system, allowing your troop to focus on destroying things without regard for their well-being.

Your remaining troops will be concentrated in remaining military bases. While the clustered troops will be more likely to sustain injuries in sustained combat, the advantage of defensive artillery can not be ignored.
Atmospheric diffusion limits the effectiveness of ionic plasma beams as an orbital bombardment weapon, but overwhelming directed energy can compensate for other shortcomings.
+750 Offensive Bombardment Damage on Preemptive Bombardment [Nakalim]: +1000 Offensive Bombardment Damage on Precision A2G Strikes
Techniques for the precision shaping of plasma blasts allows for the application of aerodynamic principles to orbital bombardment weaponry.
+750 Offensive Bombardment Damage on Preemptive Bombardment [Nakalim]: +1000 Offensive Bombardment Damage on Precision A2G Strikes
Allowing interested hobbyists access to military-spec orbital bombardment algorithms has resulted in a distributed computing network of AI-crafted bombardment patterns custom-fit to enemy defenses.
+750 Offensive Bombardment Damage on Preemptive Bombardment [Nakalim]: +1000 Offensive Bombardment Damage on Precision A2G Strikes
Strategic Resource Cost scales with 50% of Module Multiplier

Progressively increases the strength of the [industrialistColored] party. The longer it stays at the top of the queue, the more efficient. Also provides a small increase in support if not at the top of the queue, at a cost of 1 [dustColored] per [Population].

Progressively increases the strength of the [scientistColored] party. The longer it stays at the top of the queue, the more efficient. Also provides a small increase in support if not at the top of the queue, at a cost of 1 [dustColored] per [Population].

Progressively increases the strength of the [pacifistColored] party. The longer it stays at the top of the queue, the more efficient. Also provides a small increase in support if not at the top of the queue, at a cost of 1 [dustColored] per [Population].

Progressively increases the strength of the [ecologistColored] party. The longer it stays at the top of the queue, the more efficient. Also provides a small increase in support if not at the top of the queue, at a cost of 1 [dustColored] per [Population].

Progressively increases the strength of the [religiousColored] party. The longer it stays at the top of the queue, the more efficient. Also provides a small increase in support if not at the top of the queue, at a cost of 1 [dustColored] per [Population].

Progressively increases the strength of the [militaristColored] party. The longer it stays at the top of the queue, the more efficient. Also provides a small increase in support if not at the top of the queue, at a cost of 1 [dustColored] per [Population].

You will need exploration ships and probes to do this.

#006080#Use this setting only if Balanced Map Generation is Enabled.#REVERT# Exceptional galaxy size is recommended for 14 players. The Galaxy will spawn with: • 140 Nodes • 28 Isolated Nodes • ~600 Total Curiosities • 10 Minor Factions in the Galactic Core

#006080#Use this setting only if Balanced Map Generation is Enabled.#REVERT# Colossal galaxy size is recommended for 12 players. The Galaxy will spawn with: • 120 Nodes • 24 Isolated Nodes • ~500 Total Curiosities • 8 Minor Factions in the Galactic Core

#006080#Use this setting only if Balanced Map Generation is Enabled.#REVERT# Huge galaxy size is recommended for 10 players. The Galaxy will spawn with: • 100 Nodes • 20 Isolated Nodes • ~400 Total Curiosities • 5 Minor Factions in the Galactic Core

#006080#Use this setting only if Balanced Map Generation is Enabled.#REVERT# Large galaxy size is recommended for 8 players. The Galaxy will spawn with: • 80 Nodes • 16 Isolated Nodes • ~350 Total Curiosities • 4 Minor Factions in the Galactic Core

#006080#Use this setting only if Balanced Map Generation is Enabled.#REVERT# Normal galaxy size is recommended for 6 players. The Galaxy will spawn with: • 60 Nodes • 12 Isolated Nodes • ~250 Total Curiosities • 3 Minor Factions in the Galactic Core

#006080#Use this setting only if Balanced Map Generation is Enabled.#REVERT# Small galaxy size is recommended for 4 players. The Galaxy will spawn with: • 40 Nodes • 8 Isolated Nodes • ~200 Total Curiosities • 2 Minor Factions in the Galactic Core

#006080#Use this setting only if Balanced Map Generation is Enabled.#REVERT# Tiny galaxy size is recommended for 2 players. The Galaxy will spawn with: • 20 Nodes • 4 Isolated Nodes • ~100 Total Curiosities • 1 Minor Factions in the Galactic Core

#C84F4F#EXPERIMENTAL#REVERT# Enabling this will guarantee that 5-planet systems and resources are evenly distributed among constellations. #C84F4F#Only compatible with map shapes in which there are 5 constellations.#REVERT#
#C84F4F#EXPERIMENTAL#REVERT# Map will be generated with evenly distributed resources and 5-planet systems. #C84F4F#Only compatible with map shapes in which there are 5 constellations.#REVERT#
Maps will spawn with no limitation on random fluctuations.
Enabling this will guarantee an average starting Home System
Each faction will start with an average Home System.
Each faction will start with a randomly generated Home System.

This will determine the baseline colonization cap before incurring penalties for all empires.
If you are playing on a galaxy size with the recommended number of players, keeping this setting on 6 is advised. However, if you are playing with more or less players than recommendeded, it is advised that you adjust this setting accordingly.
The number of nodes per player on each galaxy size is the same, meaning a colonization cap of 6 will balancedly scale as long as you are using the recommended number of players.
This HQ is not able to trace a route to your Subsidiary. (Research Autonomous Materials or Baryonic Shielding to discover wormholes, depending on your game settings).
-30% Diplomacy [prestigeColored] Cost when Bribing or Praising Minor Factions
Automation with a balance of all FIDSI + Approval [blue-gray]Will not build Improvements that cost T2 or T3 Strategics#REVERT#
Automation focused on optimizing Population placement [blue-gray]Can not build Improvements#REVERT#
